messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: getting things done
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/5/00 8:15:18 PM Central Daylight Time, RNorell@msn.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/5/00 8:15:18 PM Central Daylight Time, RNorell@...
writes:

<< But alas, with 4 sets of grandparents, and 9 sets of aunts and uncles, my
kids STILL have too much stuff!
>>
Sounds like us, too. My oldest son will be 6 soon, and is into garage/yard
sales. Maybe he should hold one of his own! :) ~Karen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: getting things done
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/5/2000 6:15:21 PM US Mountain Standard Time, RNorell@msn.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/5/2000 6:15:21 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
RNorell@... writes:

<< They also collect Playmobils - I have 5 folding card tables set up in the
"project" room (garage) and they keep their "Playmobil City" there (up off
the floor). >>

What a wonderful idea... I'm going to steal this... Target recently had a 75%
sale on Playmobile stuff and Zak ended up with Castles and Police Stations
and Campers etc and I had no idea where to put them all. So what we have to
leave the cars out in over 100 degree weather.. I've also been thinking of
screening in my patio, putting that fake grass out there and putting the
Playmobiles out there... Now there's another option.

Dawn F
